basics.name: James Hill
basics.label: Senior Software Engineering Manager
summary: A team oriented senior software engineering lead with over 10 years experience managing engineering teams in app design, development and support across the entire development lifecycle. My previous roles have all required a strong emphasis on validation frameworks, automation strategies and process efficiencies in agile environments.

Although my background has been primarily on Microsoft tech stack, I am currently hoping to expand. Using this site to ramp up more on front-end development and gain expertise on MERN stack: Mongo-Express-Node/React/Mongo

highlights: Built and lead team a team of over 20 engineers. Active in career development, professional growth, and performance management.

Responsible for design and delivery of workflow automation tools and validation frameworks. Major deliveries include: Campaign management, Workflow automation and tracking, and UI/Service/Catalog validation frameworks.
Responsible for promoting the team’s culture, vision, strategy. Achieved 96% Work Health Index in anonymous MS Poll results.
Lead weekly Demo meetings with stakeholders to highlight team’s progress, provide transparency and promote a positive culture.
Engaged customers and peers to solicit feedback, drive clarity, identify gaps and increase efficiencies across the organization.
Responsible for implementing Web Service validation framework solution and evangelizing the automation strategy.

Designed and developed an adaptive test automation framework using a custom Html abstraction layer, to dynamically identify web elements. The system leveraged Selenium web driver and Visual Studio Test to execute tests and track results.
Mentored QA team members on implementing automation tests and general coding skills.
Hosted daily standups to address business needs, remove team impediments and reviewing Sprint project status.
Established and lead a team of SDETs responsible for testing of all mid-tier business web services.  The Services Test team was anywhere from 5-10 in-house resources (+3 outsourced).

Designed and implemented a custom test automation framework, which dynamically generated SOAP requests based on latest WSDL or XSD. Suites containing test cases were stored in SQL backend and results displayed via an ASP.Net.

Hands-on lead role within the company’s Server Core team. Coordinated efforts of a small team of SDETs over a wide range of mobile application projects and platform technologies including MIDP, BREW, RIM and Windows Mobile.

Designed and implemented test automation in C# using Visual Studio 2005 (Team Edition for Software Testers) emulating client requests to verify API interface with Mobile Application Platform (MAP) Server.

skills.title: Programming Languages
description: I've built numerous applications across full dev stack, from mobile clients to cloud.
Besides pragmatic reasons, I am building this site to ramp up further on MERN stack: Mongo-Express-React-Node

skills.title: Development Tools
description: While I do have a passion for creating and designing custom tools that can be adapted to fit the exact needs of the business, I've learned to recognize ROI and appreciate the ease of off-the-shelf solution. Here are a few that I have found most useful:

skills.title: Storage
description: Familiarity with both relational databases and no-SQL.

references.name: Cort Fritz
references.reference: James was a great dev lead. He ran a tight SCRUM with high morale and high velocity. I now have a greater appreciation for how much work and talent went into making a well run team look effortless.

references.name: Milton Berle
references.reference: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.

references.name: Napoleon Hill
references.reference: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.

references.name: Booker T. Washington
references.reference: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.

references.name: Unknown
references.reference: The person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the person who is doing it.

references.name: Colin R. Davis
references.reference: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
